III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors
Section on central registry
Description
1

(2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that staff are not appropriately supervising parenting
time and are encouraging the use of corporal punishment.
Investigation The agency Deputy Director was interviewed by telephone on
October 3, 2023. The Deputy Director provided agency contacts
for interviews. The Deputy Director reported that the agency self-
reported the allegation when information was obtained that
agency Case Aides may have been encouraging a biological
father to use corporal punishment on his son, a child in foster
care. In addition, there was an allegation that the Case Aides had
conducted parenting time supervision in their own homes.
The Deputy Director reported that Staff 1, a Case Aide, had
denied that she had conducted parenting time supervision in her
home and did not encourage corporal punishment. The Deputy
Director reported that the girlfriend of Biological Father (Bio-
Father) will make allegations against him when they are fighting
and there is relationship discord.
The agency Chief Administrator was interviewed via
telephone on October 30, 2023. Chief Administrator provided
telephone numbers of Staff 1 and Staff 2, both who are Case
Aides and have supervised parenting time visits with the Bio-
Father and Foster Child A. Chief Administrator also provided the
telephone number of Bio-Father’s girlfriend, hereafter referred to
as Complainant. Chief Administrator reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
are quality employees with no history of disciplinary problems.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on November 9, 2023.
Staff 1 verified that she has supervised parenting time for Bio-
Father and Foster Child A. Staff 1 denied she had ever informed
Bio-Father that he should use corporal punishment to discipline
Foster Child A. Staff 1 also denied she had ever conducted
parenting time in her own home. Staff 1 reported she has not
conducted any parenting supervision on this case for about six
months.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on November 11, 2023,
and November 13, 2023. Staff 2 reported she began parenting
time supervision with Bio-Father and Foster Child A in mid-June
2023. Staff 2 denied she had ever encouraged Bio-Father to use
corporal punishment on Foster Child A. Staff 2 denied she had
ever said to Bio-Father, “Whup his ass” to control or discipline
2

Foster Child A as reported by Complainant. Staff 2 further denied
she had ever told Complainant to “whup her son’s ass”. Staff 2
denied she had ever conducted parenting time with Bio-Father in
her own home.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 13,
2023. Complainant reported Staff 2 had told Bio-Father to “whup
his ass” referring to disciplining Foster Child A. Complainant also
reported Staff 2 had told her to “Whup her son’s ass” referring to
her biological son. Complainant reported Case Aides have
conducted parenting time in their own homes.
Bio-Father was interviewed via telephone on November 13,
2023. Bio-Father denied Staff 2 had ever said he should “whup his
son’s ass”. Bio-Father denied Staff 1 and Staff 2 had ever
encouraged him to use corporal punishment on his son, Foster
Child A. Bio-father further denied Staff 1 or Staff 2 had ever
conducted his parenting time in their own homes. Bio-Father
reported both Staff 1 and Staff 2 have been supportive of him and
are always appropriate when supervising his parenting time. Bio-
Father further reported Complainant has not been involved in the
case for three years and she likes to make up stories against him.
During this phone call Bio-Father’s mother, who is the
grandmother of Foster Child A, and hereafter is referred to as
Grandmother, joined the conversation. Grandmother reported
Complainant is trying to make trouble for her son and the
allegations are not true. Grandmother stated, “this has
Complainant all over it”.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of the case file was conducted.
Specifically, parenting time social work contacts were reviewed
from January 2023 through September 2023. The contacts do not
indicate that Complainant was present for parenting time.
Visitation took place at the agency office and community settings
such as a local park, at speech therapy appointments and
Walmart shopping.
Analysis Staff 1 and Staff 2 denied they encouraged Bio-Father to use
corporal punishment on his son, Foster Child A. Staff 2 denied she
told Bio-Father to “whup his ass”, referring to Foster Child A. Staff
1 and Staff 2 denied they had conducted a parenting time in their
own home. Bio-Father and Grandmother each denied Staff 1 and
Staff 2 had encouraged Bio-Father to use corporal punishment or
that Staff 2 had said, “Whup his ass”. Bio-father and Grandmother
each denied parenting time had ever occurred in the staff’s home.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
